intro: Parosela dorycnioides, commonly known as the golden mistflower, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features showy yellow to orange ray florets surrounding a central disc of smaller, tubular flowers. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and covered in fine, silky hairs, giving it a soft appearance. Parosela dorycnioides thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in rainforests or along stream banks.
